projecttitle: PROAGRI Common Fund - Phase II / Fonds commun pour le PROAGRI - Phase II
project_descrip: Short: PROAGRI COMMON FUND - PHASE II / FONDS COMMUN POUR LE PROAGRI - PHASE II Long: This program represents CIDA's continued support to the Ministry of Agriculture for the implementation of Mozambique's national program for agricultural development (known as PROAGRI). The objective of PROAGRI is to contribute to poverty reduction and improved food security by: supporting farmers in accessing seeds, fertilizers, tools, and markets to sell their products, stimulating the development of agro-industries for domestic and export markets, and promoting sustainable natural resources management and conservation. CIDA's support contributes to: connecting women and men to technology and information, improving farmers' access to market information and to agricultural markets, constructing and rehabilitating irrigation systems, capacity building within provincial and district agriculture departments to manage their human and financial resources effectively, and helping the provincial and district agriculture departments address gender inequality and HIV/AIDS. As with all budget support projects, CIDA is working in close collaboration with other donors and the Government of Mozambique to strengthen the effectiveness of its aid through: focusing on effective, transparent and accountable country systems, increasing coordination and harmonization among donors, and reinforcing mutual accountability. Sector-wide budgetary support also fosters greater policy dialogue between CIDA, government, and partners, which helps to reinforce efforts for effective, focused aid and long-term development results. Continuous monitoring and evaluation of this initiative is undertaken in coordination with other donors and the Government of Mozambique. Results as of September 2008 include: 640.2 hectares of irrigation systems built, land ownership formalized for 31 communities, and under previous CIDA funding, the outreach of extension workers increased to reach over 285,300 farmers in 2007/08 up from 177,000 in 2005. / Ce programme permet au Canada de maintenir son soutien au ministère de l'Agriculture en vue de la mise en oeuvre du programme national du Mozambique pour le développement agricole (PROAGRI). L'objectif du programme est de réduire la pauvreté et d'améliorer la sécurité alimentaire en aidant les exploitants agricoles à avoir accès à des semences, à des engrais, à des outils ainsi qu'à des marchés pour vendre leurs produits, en stimulant le développement d'agroindustries pour les marchés locaux et d'exportation, en favorisant la gestion et la conservation durables des ressources naturelles. La contribution de l'ACDI permet de fournir aux femmes et aux hommes l'accès à la technologie et à l'information, d'améliorer l'accès des exploitants à l'information sur les marchés et aux marchés agricoles, de mettre en place ou de remettre en état des systèmes d'irrigation, de renforcer la capacité des départements de l'agriculture provinciaux et de district de gérer efficacement leurs ressources humaines et financières, d'aider ces mêmes départements à lutter cont

projecttitle: A Scoping Study on Agriculture and Food Security in Burma: Challenges and Opportunities
project_descrip: Short: A SCOPING STUDY ON AGRICULTURE AND FOOD SECURITY IN BURMA: CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES Long: This project will address food security concerns in Burma in the face of decreasing rice yields and global environmental changes. A consultant with experience in the country will evaluate the situation by speaking with community stakeholders, NGOs, and community-based organizations in the field of agriculture and food security. The consultant will map areas of concern and identify needed interventions.Political transition in Burma has allowed donors to better understand the social and development contexts of the country. Inadequate development assistance and limited information prior to this transition made it difficult for donors to create development strategies. IDRC s Asia Regional Office has made several exploratory visits to Burma, followed by discussions with agencies that stressed the need to know more about the country to develop priorities and provide strategic support.Agriculture in Burma accounts for 60% of gross domestic product and employs about 65% of the labour force. Rice is the major agricultural commodity. Others include pulses, groundnuts, sesame, sugarcane, and fish. Livestock is a source of food and labour. Farmers depend mostly on rain-fed systems to cultivate rice, though there are large dams that support irrigation. A significant proportion of people still depend on shifting cultivation, an agricultural system where farmers cultivate plots of land temporarily, then abandon them to allow them to revert to their natural state. Fishing from marine and freshwater sources is also an important part of food production. There are about 300 species of fish available from freshwater sources. Burma produces enough food to feed its population, but a significant proportion of people go hungry because they do not have purchasing power.At one time, Burma exported rice, but it no longer exports because of decreasing yields. Given the global environment change and other concerns, Burma must step up its research capacity to enhance production of grains and other food crops.

projecttitle: Forest and Water Management for Mitigating the effects of Climate Change in the Middle Hills, Nepal
project_descrip: Short: FOREST AND WATER MANAGEMENT FOR MITIGATING THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE IN THE MIDDLE HILLS, NEPAL Long: The Middle Hills in the Nepal Himalayas are home to a large part of the country's population. This area has been identified as particularly vulnerable to the impacts of climate change. Low rainfall and high temperatures in the winter of 2008-2009 triggered the worst drought ever recorded in the country, drastically exacerbating the national food deficit. Major investment in irrigation systems is considered essential to cope with recurrent droughts. Such investment, however, may not be sufficient, since farmers also rely on base river flows and sediment loads, both of which are affected by changes in vegetative cover, and snow and ice melt rates. There is a major gap in locally relevant scientific knowledge in this regard.This project aims to breach that gap by documenting the specific impacts of changes in weather patterns on agricultural systems, forestry, water and livelihoods along a transect from the Tarai Plains to the high mountain zone. It also seeks to shed light on why some groups are more vulnerable to the impact of climate change than others. Researchers will investigate the critical role that forest, agriculture and water management strategies play in both adaptation to and mitigation of climate change. And, they will identify specific activities to strengthen local community resilience to the impacts of climate change. Their findings are expected to be relevant other regions of the Hindu Kush Himalaya sharing similar challenges.

projecttitle: Building Resilient Mountain Communities: Earthquake Reconstruction in Dhungentar, Nepal
project_descrip: Short: BUILDING RESILIENT MOUNTAIN COMMUNITIES: EARTHQUAKE RECONSTRUCTION IN DHUNGENTAR, NEPAL Long: A powerful 7.8 Richter magnitude earthquake hit central Nepal on April 25, 2015, causing over 8,700 deaths and more than 22,000 injuries. Hundreds of thousands of homes were flattened, some 15,000 government buildings and 288,797 residential buildings were destroyed, and some 8,000 schools and 1,000 health facilities were damaged. Over half of Nepal's districts were affected by this event.Through this project, the International Centre for Integrated Mountain Development (ICIMOD) will carry out rehabilitation and reconstruction in Dhungentar, Nepal, covering about 100 severely affected households. The focus of the intervention includes restoration of housing and public buildings, restoration of basic infrastructure such as roads and irrigation systems, and development of local capacity for better disaster mitigation and risk management through knowledge gathering, sharing, and dissemination. The goal is to build resilient mountain community model villages, with climate- and earthquake-resilient housing, and to ensure sustainable livelihoods. Communities will be actively involved in the project through their village development councils. Training will be provided to community members in sustainable rehabilitation and reconstruction in a post-disaster scenario. The efforts will help the mountain communities to better prepare for climate and non-climate hazards and the knowledge generated through the project will be shared throughout the region for better disaster planning and preparedness.

projecttitle: Local Governance and Community Development Program / Programme de gouvernance locale et de développement communautaire
project_descrip: Short: PUBLIC SECTOR POLICY AND ADM. MANAGEMENT Long: The project goal is to contribute to poverty reduction and economic growth through inclusive, responsible and accountable local governance and participatory community-led development. The program purpose is to improve access to locally and inclusively prioritised public goods and services. This is being achieved by investing in rural development, mobilizing local resources and involving communities in local development and planning.   Activities being supported include building roads, irrigation systems and electrification systems which aim to reach all 3,915 villages in Nepal. The Local Governance and Community Development Program (LGCDP) is a national multi-donor program, being implemented by the Government of Nepal's Ministry of Local Development. / Le projet vise à contribuer à la réduction de la pauvreté et à la croissance économique par une gouvernance locale inclusive et responsable, et par le développement mené par les communautés. Le but est d'améliorer l'acces aux biens et aux services publics localement et inclusivement priorisés. Ceci est réalisé en investissant dans le développement rural, en mobilisant des ressources locales et en impliquant les communautés dans le développement local et la planification.   Les activités comprennent la construction de routes, de systèmes d'irrigation et de d'électrification qui visent à atteindre tous les 3915 villages au Népal. Le Programme de gouvernance locale et de développement communautaire (PGLDC) est un programme national, multidonateurs, mis en œuvre par le ministère du Développement local du gouvernment du Népal.

projecttitle: Integrated Watershed Management / Gestion intégrée des bassins versants
project_descrip: Short: INTEGRATED WATERSHED MANAGEMENT / GESTION INTÉGRÉE DES BASSINS VERSANTS Long: The project operates in five sub-watersheds in Northern Nicaragua, comprising the headwaters of the Rio Viejo and the Estero Real. The selected watersheds are located in the departments of Madriz, Nueva Segovia, Matagalpa, Leon, Esteli, and Jinotega. The project includes two components: 1) Governance / Institutional Strengthening: The project focuses on improving service delivery by municipalities in the context of water-related initiatives. This component develops the capacity of municipalities' technical units to plan, manage finances, efficiently and effectively manage operations, and respond to community needs. 2) Private Sector Development / Environment / Watershed Management: This component works with watershed users to improve natural resource management for environmental protection and agricultural production, in the context of sub-watershed plans and municipal water resource plans. This is achieved through improving production methods, soil and water conservation, improved waste management, agro-forestry, and capacity building. / Le projet se concentre sur cinq sous-bassins au nord du Nicaragua, dans les régions du Rio Viejo et de l'Estero Real. Les sous-bassins en question se situent dans les départements de Nueva Segovia, Madriz, Esteli, Leon Norte, Matagalpa, et Jinotega. Le projet comporte deux composantes : 1) Gouvernance / renforcement institutionnel : le projet se concentre sur l'amélioration de la livraison de services par les municipalités, dans le contexte des initiatives en relation avec l'eau. projecttitle: Rural Community Water Project
project_descrip: Short: RURAL COMMUNITY WATER PROJECT Long: Project Description: Rural Community Water Project /Phase 2 This project aims to provide year-round access to clean water and complementary health and hygiene programs to 50 rural communities in Nicaragua's driest region. It also seeks to strengthen the administrative, technical and managerial capacity of the municipalities that are responsible for water management in the beneficiary communities. The project will construct water supply systems, form local Community Water Committees to manage and monitor water use, and train community members in the operation and maintenance of the water systems. It will also hold community-level campaigns and workshops on environmental health, hygiene and reforestation promotion, and conduct workshops with municipal workers on sustainable resource use and the management of water.Expected Impact: Improved quality of life in target communities. Improved income security in the target communities. Improved health and hygiene in target communities. More-supportive environment for women's participation in public life and decision making in communities and among male counterparts. Increased influence of women in community and public decision making. Increased capacity and greater self-reliance for Municipalities responsible for water management. National awareness about the importance of sustainable water management. The Alberta public starts to take seriously issues of sustainable water management in Alberta.Expected Outcomes: Improved year-round access to clean water and information on environmental health and hygiene practices. Functioning system of operation and maintenance provides remuneration for committee members including women. Strengthened knowledge and skills (negotiation & management) of women for participation in democratic or community-management bodies. Stable, secure clean water supply for the community. Access to water for irrigation and livestock # even in times of drought. Women are involved in all phases of project activities including representation on community water committees. Women benefit from close access to water and will have more time to dedicate to productive economic and recreational activities. Nicaragua as a whole benefits from municipal capacity building in sustainable water management. The environment benefits from improved practises of environmental health, hygiene and reforestation. Municipalities begin to take seriously their responsibility for water management and are provided with the information Necessary to make decisions that provide for sustainable resource use. Through the monitoring and evaluation process, beneficiaries provide feedback that is incorporated into project management. The Alberta public (especially those reached by the innovative e-technologies) becomes educated on issues of water scarcity and sustainable water management in Nicaragua and globally.     Expected Outputs: Ouputs include: Community members (including women) are organized and active in coordinating project activities and there is increased representation of women in democratic processes and in decision-making positions in the target communities. Communal ownership of water system is secured and an adequate year-round, clean water supply established for project beneficiaries. Community members are organized into committees and are trained to safely and effectively operate and maintain the water system. Water user-fee collections and maintenance initiatives are established and women benefit from remuneration for their operational and maintenance services. Environmental health and hygiene campaigns are implemented in the target communities. Beneficiaries are provided with the materials, equipment and knowledge to sustain them. Municipalities without sufficient capacity to manage water resources receive valuable training on sustainable water management. Countries: Sectors: Themes:

projecttitle: Building Research Capacity to Understand and Adapt to Climate Change in the Indus Basin
project_descrip: Short: BUILDING RESEARCH CAPACITY TO UNDERSTAND AND ADAPT TO CLIMATE CHANGE IN THE INDUS BASIN Long: The Indus river basin is home to the largest contiguous surface irrigation system in the world. In the summer of 2010, a combination of severe rainfall and unanticipated river flow resulted in a devastating flood, which was compounded by multiple institutional failures in managing the response. The experience highlighted the challenge posed by poor governance, as well as the threat of global environmental change. This grant will allow a team of researchers led by the Institute of Social and Environmental Transition (ISET) and its Pakistani affiliate (ISET-P) to map key actors in the field, carry out a rapid meta-analysis of the various post-flood situation reports, draw upon secondary data from ISET's work in the region and elsewhere to inform the government's proposed build back better program, and conduct stakeholder consultations to understand what happened along a transect in the Indus basin. The project is expected to result in a better understanding of the causes of the 2010 floods and provide a scientific basis for policymaking to address water governance and management under conditions of climate uncertainty.

projecttitle: Climate Change Adaptation, Water, and Food Security in Pakistan
project_descrip: Short: CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION, WATER, AND FOOD SECURITY IN PAKISTAN Long: Pakistan's devastating 2010 Indus basin floods left approximately one-fifth of Pakistan's land area underwater and directly affected about 20 million people. Subsequent flooding in the Indus deserts the following year also showed how vulnerable the country is to climate instability. A call for new research will advance knowledge about the key impacts of climate variability on agricultural productivity, and water and food security in Pakistan.In 2010, the world's largest contiguous irrigation system, the Indus basin, experienced severe rainfall and an unanticipated increase in river flow. Multiple institutional failures in flood and post-flood relief compounded the situation. In 2011, this highly regulated river system hindered drainage from flooding in the Sindh deserts into the Indus. In both cases, the vulnerabilities of Pakistan's poorest residents - those living in the Indus floodplains or on the edges of its deserts - received little attention. IDRC is supporting three research partners from a competitive call for proposals.  Researchers from the Pakistan Institute of Development Economics, Lahore University of Management Sciences, and Social Policy and Development Centre will address critical knowledge gaps in understanding climate-related hazards in the Indus Basin as well as the implications for marginalized communities and particularly poor women within these communities.Research will also examine vulnerability based on gender, farmers' decision-making in water stressed regions, and the wider political and economic context underpinning adaptation policy and planning. Research outputs will include peer reviewed publications, policy briefs, and technical reports. The findings will also contribute to climate change policies and national and local adaptation action plans in Pakistan. The research teams will conduct consultative dialogues and key stakeholder meetings. They will support young researchers through workshops on research methodologies, development of communication tools, and access to learning opportunities.

projecttitle: A strategy for research-policy engagement and research into use across PRISE and HI-AWARE consortia in Pakistan
project_descrip: Short: A STRATEGY FOR RESEARCH-POLICY ENGAGEMENT AND RESEARCH INTO USE ACROSS PRISE AND HI-AWARE CONSORTIA IN PAKISTAN Long: Climate change affects millions of poor people, particularly in the glacial and snow-pack-dependent river basins and semi-arid plains in Pakistan. Future projections point to scarce water resources, reduced crop yields, and ecosystem degradation that will ultimately impact businesses, public health, land use patterns, and infrastructure. Existing local level institutions are addressing the impacts of climate change however, given the scale of impact to be felt in these two regions, there is a need for more strategic policy interventions.  The Pathways to resilience in semi-arid economies (PRISE) and Himalayan adaptation, water and resilience research (HI-AWARE) consortia in Pakistan are carrying out extensive research in the mountains and semi-arid areas of the Indus plain. These demand-driven research programs will enhance understanding of the impact of climate change on economic development and the solutions that could increase the climate resilience and adaptive capacities of the most vulnerable. Their aim is to influence policy and practice that will improve livelihoods.This project, implemented with the Islamabad-based Sustainable Development Policy Institute, will help both consortia share results and develop syntheses on common research areas such as water availability and water governance. These research activities aim to identify the gaps in knowledge of the variability in river discharge, water distribution, and management of drought, flood, and other climate extremes. This work will support development of adaptation approaches as well as assessment of policies and plans for both decision-makers and vulnerable communities. The consortia will also examine the potential migration patterns and linkages across the glacier-fed river basin and irrigated semi-arid areas of the country. Policy mapping and analysis will enhance understanding of existing adaptation practices, gaps in government responses in terms of policy and planning, and climate resilience. This will be accomplished with stakeholders to improve collaboration and policy uptake across the two regions.This project is funded though the Opportunities and Synergies Fund, which is a competitive process promoting cross-consortia collaboration within the Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative in Africa and Asia (CARIAA) program. The Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative in Africa and Asia (CARIAA) aims to help build the resilience of poor people to climate change by supporting a network of consortia to conduct high-calibre research and policy engagement in hot spots in Africa and Asia. It is jointly funded by the UK's Department for International Development and IDRC.

projecttitle: Oxfam Earthquake Reconstruction Program
project_descrip: Short: OXFAM EARTHQUAKE RECONSTRUCTION PROGRAM Long: Project Description: This three year project aims to ensure that 214,000 people affected by the earthquake in the districts of Bagh (Azad Jammu Kashmir) and Shangla (North West Frontier Province) are able to reconstruct and improve their lives and livelihoods and are able to more effectively cope with future disasters in a safe, dignified and increasingly gender equitable environment. The project will focus on livelihoods, disaster preparedness, education and gender.  Some activities will include reconstructing damaged irrigation channels, preparing disaster management plans through community based processes, training teachers on trauma counselling and multi grade teaching, as well as delivering training to field staff on violence against women and rehabilitation of the survivors, and focusing on physical and emotional health of women and children.           Expected Impact: -Dignity is upheld and livelihoods are restored for people affected by the earthquake. -Communities are able to cope with future disasters -Improved access to education for women and girls -Increased awareness about women's rights and human rights among communities. Expected Outcomes: Livelihoods outcome: Livelihood sources for most vulnerable affected households in the targeted areas are restored resulting in an increase of income at the household level.   Disaster Preparedness outcome: Enhanced capacities of key stakeholders within the earthquake-affected districts for an effective and integrated disaster risk reduction.   Education and Gender outcome: Improved access to education especially for girls, increased awareness of women's rights and improved women's access to services. Expected Outputs: Livelihoods outputs: -Essential livestock is supported and preserved -Livestock and agriculture outcomes are improved -Targeted households are able to restor their main off farm activities -Increase in links between the community and local government departments -Systems and community structures are in place to sustain gains.   Disaster Preparedness outputs: -Government officials and elected representatitves are sensitised on issues of disaster risk reduction and are able to play their roles effectively while making district disaster management plans. -Increased organisational capacity of partners in responding to humanitarian emergencies at the organizational level through designated pre-positioning of emergency stocks and emergency staff kits and trainings. -Increased awareness and capacity of community based organizations (CBOs) to implement disaster preparedness plans by performing designated roles and responsibilities through trainings and emergency committees. -Disaster Coordination mechanism institutionalised at village, tehsil and district levels.   Education and Gender outputs: -Women/girls have the opportunity to learn reading, writing and counting (basic numeric) -Drop out/overage girls have an opportunity to complete primary education -Participating children demonstrate higher levels of motivation and confidence -Participating women and children are aware of their basic rights -Rehabilitation centres are providing assistance on physical and emotional health -Reductino in maternal and child mortality rate -Trained counsellors from the community are providing counselling at community level. -100 women survivors economically empowered as a result of entrepreneurship training and small grant. -Coordination and linkages are developed with government line departments, institutions and NGOs. Countries: Pakistan (100%)  Sectors: 031100 (37%), 074010 (32%), 011220 (15%), 011130 (8%), 011230 (8%)  Themes: Poverty Reduction, Capacity Development, Participatory Development, Gender Equality

The project will focus on livelihoods, disaster preparedness, education and gender.  Some activities will include reconstructing damaged irrigation channels, preparing disaster management plans through community based processes, training teachers on trauma counselling and multi grade teaching, as well as delivering training to field staff on violence against women and rehabilitation of the survivors, and focusing on physical and emotional health of women and children.           Expected Impact: -Dignity is upheld and livelihoods are restored for people affected by the earthquake. -Communities are able to cope with future disasters -Improved access to education for women and girls -Increased awareness about women's rights and human rights among communities. Expected Outcomes: Livelihoods outcome: Livelihood sources for most vulnerable affected households in the targeted areas are restored resulting in an increase of income at the household level.   Disaster Preparedness outcome: Enhanced capacities of key stakeholders within the earthquake-affected districts for an effective and integrated disaster risk reduction.   Education and Gender outcome: Improved access to education especially for girls, increased awareness of women's rights and improved women's access to services. Expected Outputs: Livelihoods outputs: -Essential livestock is supported and preserved -Livestock and agriculture outcomes are improved -Targeted households are able to restor their main off farm activities -Increase in links between the community and local government departments -Systems and community structures are in place to sustain gains.   Disaster Preparedness outputs: -Government officials and elected representatitves are sensitised on issues of disaster risk reduction and are able to play their roles effectively while making district disaster management plans. -Increased organisational capacity of partners in responding to humanitarian emergencies at the organizational level through designated pre-positioning of emergency stocks and emergency staff kits and trainings. -Increased awareness and capacity of community based organizations (CBOs) to implement disaster preparedness plans by performing designated roles and responsibilities through trainings and emergency committees. -Disaster Coordination mechanism institutionalised at village, tehsil and district levels.   Education and Gender outputs: -Women/girls have the opportunity to learn reading, writing and counting (basic numeric) -Drop out/overage girls have an opportunity to complete primary education -Participating children demonstrate higher levels of motivation and confidence -Participating women and children are aware of their basic rights -Rehabilitation centres are providing assistance on physical and emotional health -Reductino in maternal and child mortality rate -Trained counsellors from the community are providing counselling at community level. -100 women survivors economically empowered as a result of entrepreneurship training and small grant. -Coordination and linkages are developed with government line departments, institutions and NGOs. Countries: Pakistan (100%)  Sectors: 031100 (37%), 074010 (32%), 011220 (15%), 011130 (8%), 011230 (8%)  Themes: Poverty Reduction, Capacity Development, Participatory Development, Gender Equality

projecttitle: Baluchistan Responsive Fund / Fonds réactif pour le Baloutchistan
project_descrip: Short: BALUCHISTAN RESPONSIVE FUND / FONDS RÉACTIF POUR LE BALOUTCHISTAN Long: Monsoon flooding in August 2010 is affecting some CIDA projects in Pakistan. Detailed assessments of the impacts are underway. Project information will be updated as soon as possible, for projects that are affected. _______________ This project aims to reduce poverty and improve stability in selected communities of the border region by supporting locally-identified development initiatives to: (i) increase access to small-scale social services (health, education), (ii) improve small-scale local infrastructure (schools, health clinics, water canals/drainage ditches, etc.), and (iii) provide improved socio-economic opportunities for the poor (improved irrigations, construction of market roads, etc.) The project is a locally-managed fund responding to small funding requests from locally-based Pakistani non-governmental organizations to assist in building capacity locally. These organizations are well-acquainted with the socio-cultural and rural development challenges of the area. International organizations and Canadian executing agencies are eligible only if they work in partnership with a local organization. / Des inondations survenues au Pakistan en août 2010, pendant la mousson, pourraient modifier le fonctionnement de certains projets de l'ACDI. Une évaluation détaillée des effets des inondations sur les projets est en cours. La mise à jour des renseignements concernant les projets touchés sera faite dès que possible. _______________ Ce projet vise à réduire la pauvreté et à accroître la stabilité dans certaines collectivités de la région frontalière en appuyant des initiatives de développement proposées localement. Le but de ces initiatives est : i) de donner aux pauvres un meilleur accès aux infrastructures sociales de petite échelle, par exemple la santé et l'éducation, ii) d'améliorer les infrastructures de petite échelle (écoles, cliniques médicales, canaux d'irrigation/tranchées de drainage, etc.), iii) de fournir de meilleures perspectives socioéconomiques aux pauvres (en ayant une meilleure irrigation, en construisant des routes qui mènent aux marchés, etc.). Le projet comprend des fonds gérés localement, pour répondre aux demandes d'organisations non gouvernementales (ONG) pakistanaises qui peuvent aider à développer les capacités locales. Ces ONG connaissent bien le contexte socioculturel et les défis de développement rural auxquels la région est confrontée. Les organisations internationales et les agents d'exécution canadiens ne sont admissibles que s'ils travaillent en partenariat avec un organisme local.

projecttitle: Pakistan Floods 2010 - Food and Agriculture Organization 2010 / Inondations au Pakistan - Organisation des Nations Unies pour l'alimentation et l'agriculture 2010
project_descrip: Short: EMERGENCY/DISTRESS RELIEF Long: October 5, 2010 - Pakistan is experiencing its worst monsoon flooding in at least 80 years. Government estimates put the number of people affected by the floods at 21 million. Millions of people have been displaced and over 1.8 million houses have been either damaged or destroyed. Assessments to establish the degree to which affected populations are in need of immediate humanitarian assistance continue.   Through this project, CIDA is supporting the UN Food and Agriculture Organization to assist flood-affected people in Pakistan resume their livelihoods and reduce their dependence on emergency assistance. Specific activities include the provision of seeds, fertilizers and tools to help small farmers prepare their fields for the upcoming planting season, the provision of supplementary feed and veterinary services to livestock, and, repairs to important agricultural infrastructure such as irrigation canals and drainage systems. / Le 5 octobre, 2010 - Le Pakistan connaît ses pires inondations, provoquées par la mousson, depuis au moins 80 ans. Le gouvernement estime à 21 millions le nombre de personnes touchées par ces inondations. Des millions de personnes ont été déplacées et plus de 1,8 million de maisons ont été soit endommagées soit détruites. L'évaluation des besoins en aide humanitaire immédiate des populations touchées se poursuit.   Dans le cadre de ce projet, l'ACDI soutient les efforts déployés par l'Organisation des Nations Unies pour l'alimentation et l'agriculture pour aider les personnes touchées par les inondations au Pakistan à reprendre leurs activités de subsistance et réduire la dépendance de ces personnes à l'égard de l'aide d'urgence. Les activités spécifiques comprennent la fourniture de semences, d'engrais et d'outils afin d'aider les petits agriculteurs à préparer leurs champs pour la prochaine époque des semailles, la fourniture d'aliments complémentaires et de services vétérinaires pour les animaux d'élevage, ainsi que la réparation d'importantes infrastructures agricoles telles que les canaux d'irrigation et les systèmes de drainage.

projecttitle: Agrarian Information System of the Huaral Valley (Peru)
project_descrip: Short: AGRARIAN INFORMATION SYSTEM OF THE HUARAL VALLEY (PERU) Long: The Huaral valley, 100 km North of Lima, features a marginal farming population in a desert climate where scarce water is distributed by Juntas de Riego and Juntas de Usuarios (irrigation and users' committees). Access to the Agrarian Information System (SIA) of Huaral (http://www.huaral.org/SIA/) and an open source program on water (http://www.huaral.org/yacu.shtml) have demonstrated how information and communication technologies (ICTs) can benefit the farming community. Further timely, pertinent and reliable information could help local farmers adapt their production systems to local, national and external markets.''This grant will support consolidation of the Agrarian Information System through innovative hardware and software technologies. The project will include three components: a local, geo-referenced information system for more efficient water distribution, convergence of traditional media with new communication tools (Internet, VoIP, digital radio) for expanded radio coverage, and a study of the relative effectiveness of mobile telephones and personal digital assistants (PDAs) in improving farmers' productivity. Individuals from the community will be trained to update the information in the Yacu (water) distribution system, to function as rural reporters for digital audio production, and to make the most of the (market) information provided through mobile technology. Hotspots with antennas will be installed so as to offer a wider range of access to farmers.

projecttitle: Participatory Water Management and Climate Resilience for Andean Women and Men/Gestion participative de l'eau et résilience climatique pour les femmes et les hommes des Andes
project_descrip: Short: PARTICIPATORY WATER MANAGEMENT AND CLIMATE RESILIENCE FOR ANDEAN WOMEN AND MEN/GESTION PARTICIPATIVE DE L'EAU ET RÉSILIENCE CLIMATIQUE POUR LES FEMMES Long: Peru is one of the world's most vulnerable countries to climate change. The impacts of these changes (glacial melting, droughts and more frequent floods) are particularly affecting the water security of the most vulnerable populations. The effects are even greater for women and girls, whose living conditions and marginalization increase the risks. This project aims to ensure the water supply of the poorest through appropriate water management. This will be done by promoting innovative and accessible solutions (green infrastructure), which will be implemented in pilot regions and then taken up nationally. The project will be implemented with key government actors (national, regional, local) and in collaboration with local NGOs, the Peruvian, Canadian and American academic sector, indigenous Andean communities and especially women./ Le Pérou est l'un des pays les plus vulnérables au monde face aux changements climatiques. Les impacts de ces changements (fonte glaciaire, sécheresses et inondations plus fréquentes) affectent particulièrement la sécurité hydrique des populations les plus vulnérables. Les effets sont encore plus importants pour les femmes et les filles, dont les conditions de vie et la marginalisation aggravent les risques. Ce projet vise à assurer l'approvisionnement en eau des plus pauvres à travers une gestion de l'eau adaptée. Ceci sera fait en promouvant des solutions innovatrices et accessibles (infrastructures vertes), qui seront mises en œuvre dans des régions pilotes et reprises ensuite à l'échelle nationale. Le projet sera exécuté avec les acteurs clés du gouvernement (national, régional, local) et en collaboration avec les ONG locales, le secteur académique péruvien, canadien et américain, les communautés andines autochtones et plus particulièrement, les femmes.

projecttitle: Support to Rwanda-Israel's Center of Excellence in Horticulture
project_descrip: Short: SUPPORT TO RWANDA-ISRAEL'S CENTER OF EXCELLENCE IN HORTICULTURE Long: As part of the implementation of the Strategic Plan for Agriculture Transformation in Rwanda, the Government of Rwanda is investing in the development of value chains (the full process from raw material to delivery of the finished product) for strategic commodities. Horticulture represents a particularly promising opportunity for increasing farmers' incomes and generating foreign revenues. However, the sector needs to be further developed to meet the growing demand in both domestic and export markets. To unlock the potential of this sector, the Ministry of Agriculture and Animal Resources has sought support from the State of Israel to establish a center of excellence (CoE), co-financed by the State of Israel and the Government of Rwanda. The horticultural CoE aims to create a self-sustaining centre for agricultural production, training, and demonstration of new and efficient production methods and irrigation systems. It will also serve as an applied research and development centre to adapt and promote innovations for different groups of farmers, from small- and medium-scale farmers to large-scale commercial producers. The CoE will be managed by a core team from the National Agricultural Export Development Board and the Rwanda Agriculture Board. These two agencies of the Ministry of Agriculture need support to strengthen their leadership, managerial and technical skills, both for managing the CoE and for training different stakeholders in horticulture value chains. This institutional strengthening and capacity building project will support observation and networking visits for Rwandan experts to Israel's Center for International Agricultural Development Cooperation via Israel's Agency for International Development Cooperation, Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The experts will also visit CoEs in India that were established by Israeli and Indian experts within the Indo-Israel Agricultural Project. The two visits will provide Rwandan experts with first-hand experience and expose them to business models. At the end of the exchange visits, they will better understand modern horticulture production systems, and how to manage a CoE in horticultural innovations.

projecttitle: Labour-Intensive Local Development / Développement local à haute intensité de main-d'oeuvre
project_descrip: Short: AGRICULTURAL WATER RESOURCES Long: This project represents a second CIDA contribution to the Labour Intensive Local Development Programme. In its second phase, the program continues to fund infrastructure and protection initiatives, but with greater emphasis on the developmental impact of new and rehabilitated infrastucture and productive resources (terraces, marshland). The program has strengthened the component of complementary training provided to individuals and farmer organizations (e.g. sustainable farming techniques), private sector enterprises, and local governments (e.g. managing labour intensive projects and maintaining infrastructure). / Ce projet représente une deuxième contribution de l'ACDI au Programme de développement local à haute intensité de main d'oeuvre. Dans sa deuxième phase, le programme continue à financer des travaux d'infrastructure et de protection, mais avec plus d'emphase sur l'impact développemental d'infrastructures nouvelles et réhabilitées et des ressources productives (terrasses, marais). Le programme a renforcé la composante de formation complémentaire fournie aux individus et aux organisations paysannes (p. ex. pratiques agricoles durables), entreprises privées et gouvernements locaux (p. ex. gestion des projets à haute intensité de main d'oeuvre et entretien d'infrastructures).

projecttitle: Rural Development in Ruhengeri and Cyangugu / Développement rural à Ruhengeri et Cyangugu
project_descrip: Short: RURAL DEVELOPMENT IN RUHENGERI AND CYANGUGU / DÉVELOPPEMENT RURAL À RUHENGERI ET CYANGUGU Long: This project supports the rehabilitation and construction of rural infrastructure using labour-intensive approaches. The project focuses on building or rehabilitating rural roads, reforestation, and terracing hillside agricultural lands in order to protect the environment and increase productivity. The use of local labour creates temporary employment for the most vulnerable citizens and contributes to increased economic activity in project zones. In the longer term, the project aims to contribute to the diversification of the rural economy and to poverty reduction. CIDA's contribution is made through delegated cooperation with the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. / Ce projet appuie des initiatives de réhabilitation et construction de petites infrastructures rurales effectués selon le mode de la haute intensité en main d'oeuvre. Le projet permet principalement de construire ou réhabiliter des pistes rurales, de faire du reboisement et de faire du terrassement des pentes cultivées afin de réhabiliter l'environnement et accroître la productivité des terres. Le recours à la main d'oeuvre locale crée de l'emploi temporaire au bénéfice des plus démunis et augmente l'activité économique dans les zones du projet. À long terme, le projet vise à contribuer à la diversification de l'économie rurale et à la réduction de la pauvreté. L'ACDI contribue au projet en coopération déléguée avec le Ministère des affaires extérieures des Pays-Bas.

The project focuses on building or rehabilitating rural roads, reforestation, and terracing hillside agricultural lands in order to protect the environment and increase productivity. The use of local labour creates temporary employment for the most vulnerable citizens and contributes to increased economic activity in project zones. In the longer term, the project aims to contribute to the diversification of the rural economy and to poverty reduction. CIDA's contribution is made through delegated cooperation with the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. / Ce projet appuie des initiatives de réhabilitation et construction de petites infrastructures rurales effectués selon le mode de la haute intensité en main d'oeuvre. Le projet permet principalement de construire ou réhabiliter des pistes rurales, de faire du reboisement et de faire du terrassement des pentes cultivées afin de réhabiliter l'environnement et accroître la productivité des terres. Le recours à la main d'oeuvre locale crée de l'emploi temporaire au bénéfice des plus démunis et augmente l'activité économique dans les zones du projet. À long terme, le projet vise à contribuer à la diversification de l'économie rurale et à la réduction de la pauvreté. L'ACDI contribue au projet en coopération déléguée avec le Ministère des affaires extérieures des Pays-Bas.

projecttitle: Nile Basin - Trade and Agriculture Production / Commerce et production agricole - Bassin du Nil
project_descrip: Short: NILE BASIN - TRADE AND AGRICULTURE PRODUCTION / COMMERCE ET PRODUCTION AGRICOLE - BASSIN DU NIL Long: The Trade and Agricultural Production-Nile Basin Initiative forms part of the Nile Equatorial Lakes Subsidiary Action Program (NELSAP). NELSAP, in turn, forms part of the Nile Basin Initiative (NBI). The NBI's vision is to achieve sustainable socio-economic development in the Nile Basin countries through equitable development of the Basin's shared water resources and attendant benefits. The project is based on the finding that the Equatorial Lakes sub-watershed countries have poorly developed their potential for agricultural production. Increased production could be exported to other Basin countries that have trouble meeting their food requirements. The project includes activities focused mainly on irrigation and various water collection and conservation techniques, livestock production, and marketing of agricultural products. The project will helps to strengthen the management of irrigation and livestock production, and contributes to making the regulatory environment more suited to Basin-wide production, marketing, and trade. Given the available financial resources in relation to the scope of the challenge, the project mainly facilitates pilot initiatives in hopes that they can be applied on a larger scale. / Le projet Commerce et production agricole - Initiative du bassin du Nil, fait partie du Programme d'action subsidiaire des pays des lacs équatoriaux du bassin du Nil (NELSAP). Ce programme fait lui-même partie de l'Initiative du bassin du Nil (IBN) dont la vision est de réaliser un développement socioéconomique durable dans les pays riverains du bassin du Nil, au moyen d'une exploitation équitable des ressources en eau communes et des bienfaits qui en découlent. Le projet s'appuie sur le constat que le potentiel de productivité agricole des pays du sous-bassin des lacs équatoriaux est mal exploité et qu'une production accrue pourrait être exportée vers les autres pays du bassin dont les besoins alimentaires sont mal remplis. Ce projet comprend des activités qui seront principalement liées à l'irrigation et à diverses techniques de captage et de conservation de l'eau, à l'élevage, ainsi qu'à la mise en marché des produits agricoles. Ce projet contribuera à renforcer la gestion de l'irrigation et de l'élevage et à mieux adapter le régime réglementaire à la production et à la commercialisation de produits, ainsi qu'aux échanges commerciaux à l'échelle du bassin. Compte tenu de ressources financières disponibles par rapport à l'ampleur du défi, le projet permet surtout la réalisation d'expériences pilotes dans l'espoir qu'elles pourront être appliquées à plus grande échelle.

projecttitle: Land Husbandry, Water Harvesting and Hillside Irrigation Project / Projet en gestion intégrée des sols et des eaux
project_descrip: Short: LAND HUSBANDRY, WATER HARVESTING AND HILLSIDE IRRIGATION PROJECT / PROJET EN GESTION INTÉGRÉE DES SOLS ET DES EAUX Long: The project aims to increase the productivity and commercialization of hillside agriculture in target areas, enhancing food security and the livelihoods of the Rwandan population. Core activities include: Construction of hillside terraces, water reservoirs, irrigation systems, and marketing infrastructure, Provision of training activities to develop the capacity of agricultural organizations, entrepreneurs, local governments, and the Ministry of Agriculture and Animal Resources in a range of areas (hillside land husbandry technologies and techniques, soil erosion control, integrated watershed management, infrastructure maintenance, community mobilization and participation, administrative and financial management, rural finance, equality between men and women, phytosanitary, organizations' affairs, and, value added and marketing of products), Promotion of linkages between producer organizations and entrepreneurs with trading/export capabilities. / Le projet vise à accroitre le rendement et la commercialisation des cultures sur les versants des collines dans les zones ciblées, permettant ainsi une plus grande sécurité alimentaire et une amélioration de la qualité de vie de la population rwandaise. Les principales activités comprennent : la construction de terrasses et de retenues d'eau pour l'irrigation agricole ainsi que la mise en place d'une infrastructure nécessaire à l'activité commerciale, la formation pour le développement des capacités des organisations agricoles, des entrepreneurs, des gouvernements locaux et du ministère de l'Agriculture et des Ressources Animales dans une série de domaines (p.ex. technologies et techniques d'aménagement du sol sur les versants, contrÃ'le de l'érosion des sols, la gestion intégrée des bassins versants, l'entretien des infrastructures, la mobilisation communautaire et la participation, la gestion administrative et financière, les produits financiers adaptés au milieu rural, l'égalité entre les femmes et les hommes, la valeur ajoutée et la commercialisation des produits), et la promotion de relations entre les organisations de producteurs et les entrepreneurs ayant la capacité à faire du commerce d'exportation.

projecttitle: Learning Environmental Adaptations for Food Security / Apprentissage de techniques d'adaptation environnementale pour la sécurité alimentaire
project_descrip: Short: LEARNING ENVIRONMENTAL ADAPTATIONS FOR FOOD SECURITY / APPRENTISSAGE DE TECHNIQUES D'ADAPTATION ENVIRONNEMENTALE POUR LA SÉCURITÉ ALIMENTAIRE Long: This project aims to increase access to sufficient, nutritious and safe food among those most vulnerable to climate change in the refugee/returnee areas of the Gatsibo and Kayonza Districts in Rwanda. It seeks to do this by improving household nutrition and income-generation through climate change adaptation initiatives targeting households and cooperatives that take into account both women and men.   The project seeks to address the challenges related to climate change such as prolonged droughts, unpredictable seasons, increased storms, and unpredictable rains. Small farm holders often have little or no arable land or water for irrigation. Deforestation has contributed to increased soil erosion, soil exhaustion and adversely affected water sources. All of these factors negatively affect crop production and household incomes, limiting people's ability to produce or purchase food. The project aims to increase access to vegetables and fruits for consumption and create income-generating opportunities for 36,480 people. / Ce projet vise à permettre aux personnes les plus vulnérables au changement climatique, d'augmenter leur accès à suffisamment d'aliments sains et nutritifs dans les régions des réfugiés/rapatriés des districts de Gatsibo et Kayonza au Rwanda. Il cherche à le faire en améliorant l'alimentation des familles et la génération de revenus par l'entremise d'initiatives d'adaptation au changement climatique qui visent les familles et les coopératives, et prennent en considération à la fois les femmes et les hommes.   Le projet cherche à répondre aux défis liés au changement climatique comme les sécheresses prolongées, les saisons imprévisibles, l'augmentation des tempêtes et la pluviosité aléatoire. Les petits agriculteurs ont souvent peu ou pas de terres arables ni d'eau pour l'irrigation. La déforestation a contribué à augmenter l'érosion des sols, l'épuisement des sols et a affecté de manière adverse les sources d'eau. Tous ces facteurs négatifs ont un impact sur la production des récoltes et les revenus des familles, limitant la capacité des gens à produire ou à acheter des aliments. Le projet vise à augmenter l'accès à des légumes et à des fruits pour la consommation, et à créer des occasions génératrices de revenus pour 36 480 personnes.

projecttitle: Rural Entrepreneurship Support Project / Projet d'appui à l'entrepreneuriat paysan
project_descrip: Short: RURAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP SUPPORT PROJECT / PROJET D'APPUI À L'ENTREPRENEURIAT PAYSAN Long: This project aims to improve the performance of small horticulture and garden market enterprises (in onions and potatoes) farms by supporting the protection, management and sustainable use of forest resources in Niayes (the coastal region of the Great Coast, between Dakar and Saint-Louis). Noteworthy results as of March 31, 2008: The project has helped to make the onion sector more competitive, thus improving the quality of its products, marketing, and consultation of producers and other stakeholders in the sector. The project has also allowed better management of forest perimeters, especially by designing management and development plans. / Ce projet vise à améliorer le rendement des petites entreprises horticoles et maraîchères (dont l'oignon et la pomme de terre) tout en appuyant la protection, l'aménagement et l'exploitation durable des ressources forestières dans la région des Niayes (zone littorale de la Grande Côte située entre Dakar et Saint-Louis). Résultats notables au 31 mars 2008 : Le projet a contribué à rendre la filière oignon plus compétitive, se traduisant par une amélioration de la qualité des produits, une meilleure commercialisation et une meilleure concertation de la part des producteurs et autres acteurs de la filière. Le projet a également permis d'améliorer la gestion des périmètres forestiers à travers, notamment, le développement de plans d'aménagement et de gestion.

projecttitle: Land Use and Economic Development of the Niayes Region / Aménagement et développement économique des Niayes
project_descrip: Short: LAND USE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE NIAYES REGION / AMÉNAGEMENT ET DÉVELOPPEMENT ÉCONOMIQUE DES NIAYES Long: The goal of the Program for Land Use and Economic Development of Niayes (PADEN) is to help to increase production and marketing of onions, garlic, potatoes, beans, tomatoes, cabbages, limes, watermelons, mangoes, papayas, and strawberries in the Niayes region. The purpose of the project is to increase the incomes of 17,000 producers (women and men), to make them true entrepreneurs, and to protect the region's natural resources. At least half of these producers will be women. The current program builds on the achievements of previous CIDA projects in the horticultural and forestry sectors, and in strengthening producers' organizations (both women and men). However, this new activity takes the form of a program-based approach. Five government technical services and eight rural communities will be the project's key partners, with the Directorate of Horticulture of the Ministry of Agriculture as the sponsoring ministry. This program makes it possible to consolidate past activities, especially those involving the filao strip. Support activities are also needed for the whole sector that aims to strengthen producers' organizations and certain public institutions. Finally, the program considers water research, agricultural and forest production, supply chain storage and packaging infrastructures, access to inputs and loans, and the regulatory environment (land use). / Le programme d'aménagement et de développement économique des Niayes (PADEN) a comme objectif de contribuer à l'augmentation de la production et de la commercialisation de l'oignon, de l'ail, de la pomme de terre, du haricot, de la tomate, du chou, de la lime, de la pastèque, de la mangue, de la papaye et de la fraise dans la zone des Niayes. Il vise à accroître les revenus de 17 000 producteurs et productrices et à en faire de véritables entrepreneurs, tout en protégeant les ressources naturelles de la zone. De ce nombre, au moins 50 % seront des femmes. Le présent programme s'appuie sur les acquis des précédents projets de l'ACDI autant dans les secteurs horticole et forestier que dans le renforcement des organisations de producteurs (trices). Cependant, il s'agit d'une nouvelle intervention sous la forme d'une approche-programme. Cinq services techniques de l'État et huit communautés rurales sont les partenaires principaux du programme, avec et la direction de l'horticulture du ministère de l'Agriculture en tant que ministère de tutelle. Ce programme permet la consolidation des actions passées, notamment au niveau de la bande de filaos. De plus, tout le secteur du renforcement des organisations de producteurs et de certaines institutions publiques demande aussi des interventions d'appui. Enfin, le programme prend en compte la recherche sur l'eau, les productions agricoles et forestières, les infrastructures de stockage et de conditionnement des filières, l'accès aux intrants et au crédit ainsi que l'environnement réglementaire (la question foncière).

projecttitle: West Africa Regional Market Development / Développement du Marché financier régional - Ouest africain
project_descrip: Short: WEST AFRICA REGIONAL MARKET DEVELOPMENT / DÉVELOPPEMENT DU MARCHÉ FINANCIER RÉGIONAL - OUEST AFRICAIN Long: The goal of the West Africa Regional Financial Market Development Program is to help reduce poverty, and to contribute to sustainable economic and monetary growth, within the West African Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU). Its purpose is to increase the WAEMU market's credibility and performance by mobilizing more public savings in an environment conducive to the transparency, security, and integrity of transactions. This US$408 million program was developed under the auspices of the West African Development Bank (WADB) and the World Bank. The bulk of this funding is allocated for regional road repairs (paving of dirt roads, rehabilitation of paved roads, hydro and irrigation dams). This comprehensive program has three components: technical assistance and institutional support, development loans, and a guarantee facility. Canada's support focused on technical assistance and institutional support. Results since 2005 include the following: The West African Development Bank (WABD) has modernized its rules of procedure for procuring goods, works, and services. Operational managers have been trained to use the transportation infrastructure project management evaluation tool. / Le Programme de Développement du Marché financier régional de l'Afrique de l'Ouest a pour objectif de contribuer à la réduction de la pauvreté et à la croissance économique et monétaire durable de l'Union économique et monétaire de l'Afrique de l'Ouest (UEMOA). Son but est d'augmenter la crédibilité et la performance du marché financier de l'UEMOA par une mobilisation accrue de l'épargne publique dans un environnement propice à la transparence, à la sécurité et à l'intégrité des transactions. Ce programme d'une valeur totale de 408 millions de dollars américains a été élaboré sous l'égide de la Banque Ouest-Africaine de Développement (BOAD) et de la Banque mondiale, dont la majeure partie vise le financement d'infrastructures routières régionales (bitumage de routes en terre et réhabilisation de routes déjà bitumées, barrages hydrauliques et d'irrigation), dont l'objectif est l'intégration régionale. Ce programme global comprend trois volets : une assistance technique et un appui institutionnel, un crédit de développement et une facilité de garantie. L'appui du Canada concerne seulement l'assistance technique et l'appui institutionnel. Les résultats depuis 2005 incluent: la modernisation des règles de procédures d'acquisition des biens, travaux et services de la BOAD et la formation des cadres opérationnels à l'outil d'évaluation et de gestion des projets d'infrastructure de transport.

projecttitle: Niayes Support Fund / Fonds d'appui aux Niayes
project_descrip: Short: NIAYES SUPPORT FUND / FONDS D'APPUI AUX NIAYES Long: The Niayes Support Fund is a responsive fund that aims to contribute to sustainable economic development in the Niayes region by providing financial assistance to projects in the areas of market farming, forest management, and water resource protection, and strengthening the capacity of Senegalese organizations active in these sectors. The cooperation section of the Canadian embassy in Dakar manages the Fund locally. Noteworthy results as of March 31, 2008: Via the projects implemented, this initiative has helped to improve agricultural production through better use of pesticides, and establish proven methods of mango fruit fly control. The project has improved management and use of water resources through regular dissemination of resource status information and has increased crop diversification in Les Niayes by reintroducing the garlic crop. Finally, the project has contributed to sustainable development of the beefwood forested strip. / Le Fonds d'appui aux Niayes est un fonds réactif qui a pour objectif de contribuer au développement économique durable de la zone des Niayes par le financement de projets dans les secteurs de la production maraîchère, de la gestion de la forêt, de la protection de la ressource eau et du renforcement des capacités des organisations sénégalaises actives dans ces secteurs. Le Fonds est géré localement par la section de coopération de l'ambassade du Canada à Dakar. Résultats notables au 31 mars 2008 : L'initiative a permis, à travers les projets mis en oeuvre, d'améliorer la production agricole par une meilleure utilisation des pesticides et d'établir des méthodes de lutte éprouvées contre la mouche des fruits de la mangue. Il a également permis d'améliorer la gestion et de l'utilisation des ressources en eau par la diffusion régulière d'information sur l'état de la ressource, d'augmenter la diversification des cultures dans les Niayes par la réintroduction de la culture de l'ail et de contribuer à l'aménagement durable de la bande forestière de filao.

projecttitle: PDMAS: développement marchés agricoles
project_descrip: Short: PDMAS: DÉVELOPPEMENT MARCHÉS AGRICOLES Long: Project Description: PDMAS: développement marchés agricoles   favorables à l'émergence d'une agriculture moderne et compétitive permettant aux opérateurs économiques et aux petits producteurs de se positionner avantageusement sur les marchés à forte valeur ajoutée au niveau national et international. Le PDMAS est constitué des composantes suivantes: i- Amélioration des conditions de mise en marché, ii- Développement des exportations agricoles, iii- Développement de l'irrigation privée, iv- Gestion, suivi, coordination et évaluation, v- Activités sous gestion de l'ACDI. Un montant de 700,000$ en contributions servira pour cette dernière composante.Expected Impact: Amélioration durable (60%) des revenus des populations rurales, hommes et femmes en augmentant les capacités de production, en diversifiant les zones et les systèmes de production et en valorisant mieux l'offre en produits agricoles.Expected Outcomes: 1- Consolidation des systèmes de distribution (locale et régionale) des produits agricoles et amélioration de la sécurité sanitaire des aliments au niveau des marchés domestiques,   2- Accroissement des exportations de produits horticoles et de produits agricoles non traditionnels,   3- Consolidation et accroissement de l'offre de produits et diversification de la production irriguée par une implication décisive de promoteurs privés,   4- Accélération de la mise en #uvre des réformes foncières,   5. 1- Professionalisation accrue et amélioration significative de la compétitivité des femmes dans la filière horticole. 5.2- Accroissement de l'influence des femmes dans le secteur. Expected Outputs: 1.1- Consolidation des chaînes d'approvisionnement domestiques, 1.2- Développement de modèles d'infrastructures pour les marchés ruraux, 1.3- Amélioration de la gestion et du partage de  l'information, 1.4- Régulation des importations,   2.1- Développement des infrastructures de soutien aux exportations notamment des Centres ruraux pour l'innovation et la qualité (CRIQ) et des  Périmètres logistiques aménagés en zone de production agricole (PLAZA), 2.2- Développement des institutions d'exportation,   3.1- Promotion de la micro-irrigation, 3.2- Gestion des connaissances et conduite d'études stratégiques, 3.3- Restauration de l'irrigation dans les zones prioritaires, 3.4- Construction/réhabilitation de piste de raccordement,   4.1- Elaboration de la stratégie de recherche de financement, 4.2- Élaboration d'un cadastre rural,   5.1- Renforcement des capacités techniques et manégériales des femmes, 5.2- Amélioration de l'accès des femmes aux facteurs de production (terre, intrants, équipements, crédit) et des conditions de travail pour les femmes, 5.3- Amélioration du positionnement des femmes dans la filière horticole. Gender Equality Measures: Dans toutes les approches et activités du PDMAS, les axes stratégiques suivants devront être pris en compte: - Appui au positionnement des femmes dans les secteurs où elles ont déjà une valeur ajoutée, et au sein des regroupements de producteurs mixtes, - Renforcement des capacités et professionnalisation des producteurs et productrices ainsi que des regroupements de producteurs et productrices, - Promotion de pratiques d'emplois de qualité, sensibilisation des entreprises (PME et grandes entreprises) aux mesures de soutien des capacités féminines dans leur milieu de travail, - Appui au dialogue et à la concertation des acteurs réunissant les différents acteurs (publics, privés, société civile, #) pour développer une vision commune et une action concertée en matière d'égalité entre les sexes. Countries: Senegal (100%)  Sectors: 031120 (25%), 025010 (20%), 031161 (20%), 031140 (15%), 031162 (15%), 021061 (5%)  Themes: Poverty Reduction, Capacity Development, Gender Equality, Food Security, Environment, Trade related technical assistance / trade capacity building

projecttitle: Support to Agricultural Capacity Strengthening / Appui au renforcement des capacités agricoles
project_descrip: Short: SUPPORT TO AGRICULTURAL CAPACITY STRENGTHENING / APPUI AU RENFORCEMENT DES CAPACITÉS AGRICOLES Long: The project aims at enhancing food security for approximately 259,000 people in the Casamance, Fatick, Kaolack, Kaffrine, Tamba, Kédougou, Louga and Matam regions. To reach this goal, the project seeks to increase rice, fruit and vegetable production through the provision of training and technical advice, seeds, as well as the construction of land protection and irrigation structures. / Le projet vise à accroitre la sécurité alimentaire d'approximativement 259 000 personnes en Casamance et dans les régions de Fatick, Kaolack, Kaffrine, Tamba, Kédougou, Louga et Matam. Pour ce faire, le projet favorise une augmentation de la production de riz, de fruits et de légumes à travers des activités de formation et de conseils techniques, la fourniture de semences, et la réalisation d'ouvrages d'irrigation et de protection des terres agricoles.

projecttitle: Programme for Land Use and Economic Development of the Niayes Region/Programme d'aménagement et de développement économique des Niayes
project_descrip: Short: PROGRAMME FOR LAND USE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE NIAYES REGION/PROGRAMME D'AMÉNAGEMENT ET DE DÉVELOPPEMENT ÉCONOMIQUE DES NIAYES Long: The Land Use and Economic Development of the Niayes Region Program (PADEN) aims to increase the income of producers (both women and men) through the development of horticulture and forestry, by enhancing the productive potential of the Niayes region through innovation, entrepreneurship and the development of the provision of quality services. The project focuses on the onion, potato, carrot, cabbage and filao wood sectors, and targets horticultural and forestry producers (about 6,000 men and 3,000 women) and their organizations.The Program is structured around two components: 1) support for horticultural and agro forestry development, with funding for innovative business plans initiated by producers (both women and men) through the Economic Development Window (GDE), and 2) strengthening of support mechanisms and services for producers (both women and men), with financial support for support stakeholders (producers' apex association, national directorates and agencies, research institutions, local communities in the region)./ Le Programme d'aménagement et de développement économique des Niayes (PADEN) vise à accroître les revenus des producteurs et productrices par le développement de l'horticulture et de la foresterie en mettant en valeur le potentiel productif de la zone des Niayes par l'innovation, l'entreprenariat, et le développement de l'offre de services de qualité. Les filières ciblées par le projet sont l'oignon, la pomme de terre, la carotte, le chou et le bois de filao. Le projet cible approximativement 6 000 producteurs et 3 000 productrices horticoles et forestiers et leurs organisations.Le Programme est structuré autour de deux composantes : 1) appui au développement horticole et agroforestier, avec le financement de plans d'affaires innovants initiés par les producteurs et productrices à travers le guichet de développement économique et 2) renforcement des structures d'appui et de services aux producteurs et productrices, avec un appui financier à des acteurs d'accompagnement (association faîtière de producteurs, directions et agences nationales, institutions de recherche, collectivités locales de la zone).

projecttitle: Adaptation and Valorization of Entrepreneurship in Irrigated Agriculture/Adaptation et valorisation entrepreneuriales en irrigation et agriculture rurales (AVENIR)
project_descrip: Short: ADAPTATION AND VALORIZATION OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP IN IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE/ADAPTATION ET VALORISATION ENTREPRENEURIALES EN IRRIGATION ET AGRICULTURE RUR Long: The project aims to improve the socio-economic well-being and resilience of farming households, especially women and youth, in the Sédhiou and Tambacounda regions of Senegal, through climate friendly agricultural and irrigation practices. Among other things, the project stands out for its approach of adopting innovative and affordable technologies and using smart practices in agriculture by women and youth. The project focuses on creating public-private partnerships with financial institutions, among others, to ensure access to financing, and partnerships with private companies for the purchase of agricultural products. Project activities include: (1) developing customized training programs for women and youth in topics such as financial management, business planning, climate change, (2) administering and disseminating market research on the needs of farming households, especially of women and youth, to agricultural input and irrigation service providers, and (3) developing multi-stakeholder platforms for women and youth for a common dialogue on water resources management. / Le projet vise à améliorer le bien-être socio-économique et la résilience des ménages agricoles, en particulier des femmes et des jeunes, dans les régions de Sédhiou et de Tambacounda au Sénégal, via des pratiques agricoles et d'irrigation adaptées au climat. Le projet se distingue, entre autres, par une approche visant l'adoption de technologies innovantes et abordables, et l'utilisation de pratiques intelligentes en agriculture par les femmes et les jeunes. Le projet mise sur la création de partenariats public-privés, entre autres, avec des institutions financières pour assurer l'accès au financement, et avec des compagnies privées pour acheter les produits agricoles. Les activités du projet comprennent : 1) l'élaboration de programmes de formation, personnalisés pour les femmes et les jeunes, tels que la gestion financière, la planification d'entreprise, les changements climatiques, 2) l'administration et la diffusion d'études de marché aux fournisseurs de services d'intrants agricoles et d'irrigation sur les besoins des ménages agricoles, en particulier des femmes et des jeunes, 3) le développement de plateformes multi-acteurs pour les femmes et les jeunes pour un dialogue commun autour de la gestion des ressources en eau.

projecttitle: Women, Agriculture and Resilience in Senegal/Femmes et agriculture résilentes (FAR) au Sénégal
project_descrip: Short: WOMEN, AGRICULTURE AND RESILIENCE IN SENEGAL/FEMMES ET AGRICULTURE RÉSILENTES (FAR) AU SÉNÉGAL Long: The project aims to transform gender and age group relations in Senegal in order to improve the status of women, young women and young men, as well as their influence and decision making power within their households, communities and farming organizations. It aims to increase access to economic opportunities that are adapted to climate change in irrigated crop sectors. The project also aims to increase the ability of women and young adults to control agricultural resources. It facilitates cooperation among stakeholders of integrated management processes for water resources through irrigated crops adapted to climate change. Project activities include: 1) developing training modules for emerging women and youth leaders on rights, leadership, and gender and intergenerational issues, 2) analyzing markets in target sectors to identify cost-effective and innovative opportunities based on adaptation priorities, and 3) identifying common adaptation strategies for climate variability and the resources available to address climate risks.. / Le projet vise à transformer les rapports de genre et entre les groupes d'âge au Sénégal afin de contribuer à améliorer le positionnement des femmes, des jeunes femmes et des jeunes hommes, ainsi qu'à leur pouvoir d'influence et de décision au sein de leur ménage, de leurs communautés et des organisations de producteurs agricoles. Le projet vise à augmenter l'accès à des opportunités économiques qui sont adaptées aux changements climatiques, et ce, dans les filières de cultures irriguées. Le projet vise aussi à augmenter le contrôle des femmes et de jeunes adultes sur les ressources du secteur de l'agriculture. Il permet la facilitation de la concertation des acteurs dans les processus de gestion intégrée des ressources en eau, par des cultures irriguées adaptées aux changements climatiques. Les activités du projet comprennent : 1) développer des modules de formation aux leaders émergents femmes et jeunes sur les droits, le leadership, les enjeux de genre et intergénérationnels, 2) analyser des marchés dans les filières ciblées pour dégager les opportunités innovantes rentables, en fonction des mesures d'adaptation prioritaires, 3) identifier des stratégies d'adaptation courantes à la variabilité climatique et les ressources disponibles pour faire face aux risques climatiques.

Les activités du projet comprennent : 1) développer des modules de formation aux leaders émergents femmes et jeunes sur les droits, le leadership, les enjeux de genre et intergénérationnels, 2) analyser des marchés dans les filières ciblées pour dégager les opportunités innovantes rentables, en fonction des mesures d'adaptation prioritaires, 3) identifier des stratégies d'adaptation courantes à la variabilité climatique et les ressources disponibles pour faire face aux risques climatiques.

projecttitle: Providing Food and Nutritional Assistance in Senegal - Response to Coronavirus (COVID-19)/Fournir une assistance alimentaire et nutritionnelle au Sénégal - Réponse au coronavirus (COVID-19)
project_descrip: Short: PROVIDING FOOD AND NUTRITIONAL ASSISTANCE IN SENEGAL - RESPONSE TO CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19)/FOURNIR UNE ASSISTANCE ALIMENTAIRE ET NUTRITIONNELLE AU SÉNÉ Long: This project aims to help vulnerable populations cope with the negative effects of COVID 19 and the restrictions put in place by the Senegalese government to fight it. This project seeks to help vulnerable households avoid resorting to negative coping strategies, minimize the risk of acute malnutrition and prevent micronutrient deficiencies from being exacerbated in pregnant and lactating women. This project also helps stabilize and improve immediate access to the nutritious foods required, so that beneficiaries can truly participate in the project initiatives.  Project activities include the following: (1) distributing unconditional cash transfers to targeted beneficiaries during the hunger gap and during the COVID 19 crisis, (2) providing mothers of students associations with training and capacity-building sessions to increase income-generating activities and boost their incomes, and (3) improving farmers' access to food security by providing assistance to create community assets.  This project expects to reach 8 regions and 20 departments, as well as 806,188 beneficiaries. / Ce projet vise à aider les populations vulnérables à affronter les conséquences négatives de la COVID-19, et des mesures restrictives prises par le gouvernement sénégalais pour y faire face. Ce projet s'efforce à aider les ménages vulnérables à ne pas recourir à des stratégies d'adaptation négatives, à minimiser les risques de malnutrition aigüe, et à éviter que les carences en micronutriments ne soient exacerbées chez les femmes enceintes et allaitantes. Ce projet permet également à stabiliser et à améliorer l'accès immédiat aux aliments nutritifs requis, afin que les bénéficiaires puissent réellement participer aux initiatives du projet.  Les activités du projet comprennent : 1) distribuer des transferts d'argent comptant inconditionnels aux bénéficiaires ciblés pendant la période de soudure et pendant la crise COVID-19, 2) offrir des formations et des sessions de renforcement des capacités des associations des mères d'élèves réalisés pour accroitre les activités génératrices de revenus et leurs revenus, 3) améliorer l'accès à la sécurité alimentaire des producteurs à travers l'assistance pour la création d'actifs communautaires.  Le projet vise à atteindre 8 régions et 20 départements ciblés, ainsi que 806 188 bénéficiaires.
